item.title: Behind the scenes of RSCR
item.dc:creator: @Anc13ntsIsBack Anc13ntsIsBack
item.description:
@Anc13ntsIsBack wrote:

[quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=510271.msg3708852#msg3708852 date=1313210613]You’re intentionally bypassing the encryption… There is absolutely no legitimate reason to do so.

As above. Not that it matters though, anyone that plays something you run and actually uses login credentials they care about are either retarded or just haven’t heard of you before. I hope for their sake their details are different to RSCE.[/quote]
I’ve said about 20+ times to always use a different password than other servers. (ie: Rscemulation since its the only other one up.)

Read full topic

item.title: Behind the scenes of RSCR
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Anc13ntsIsBack, post:32, topic:408987”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=510271.msg3706415#msg3706415 date=1313072403]

I don’t give them direct access. I gave him Dropbox access which I can see what he does then the server was updated. Mark did not put any malicious code in the source at all, since I could see everything he did.

lol the Programmer? and @Nothing that wasn’t me obviously. I paid TX to fix a bug for me. He obviously couldn’t just do that.

I paid him to fix a bug, & the client is not infected… You can check it easily. You just made your self look really stupid as saying that and not checking it for yourself.

And I didn’t add that command, It was Mark. & I already removed it. Also, if you say that about that Runescape, what would be the point in a command? Nice lie.

Your story is obviously rock solid, and always consistent…
[/quote]

I don’t see how that command is malicious? It was an Administrator command. if you’re going to say its malicious because an Administrator could have saw someones password means you should say a majority of the Runescape 2 section is malicious since most of them don’t use a encryption for their passwords.

Keith thought that when ‘Marko’ joined the team the player count went down (Obviously he don’t want to blame himself)
So he demoted ‘Marko’ in hope that the player count goes up… Seems like its dropped to 10 players, GJ.

You act like you know what was going on when you have no clue.[/quote]

You’re intentionally bypassing the encryption… There is absolutely no legitimate reason to do so.

Read full topic

item.title: Behind the scenes of RSCR
item.dc:creator: @Anc13ntsIsBack Anc13ntsIsBack
item.description:
@Anc13ntsIsBack wrote:

There would be no point to evaluate your client at this time as you could of easily removed the code at any time prior to this conversation. The evidence alone speaks for itself...

http://uppit.com/9dui73e1tmhu/RscReloadedv19.zip - My client the latest one - You said I probably removed the malicious “code” there seems to be over 400 downloads, check it for yourself.

When he was in a position of accessing server/client-side code, it automatically became justifiable to say that he easily could of planted malicious code due to his history. The difference being, Luke (i'm not precisely sure how he operates dev), would not give over complete access or allow him to be in a position to plant malicious code without having looked at it/secured every end (most competent administrators understand security is #1).
would not give over complete access or allow him to be in a position to plant malicious code without having looked at it/secured every end (most competent administrators understand security is #1).

I don’t give them direct access. I gave him Dropbox access which I can see what he does then the server was updated. Mark did not put any malicious code in the source at all, since I could see everything he did.

It's not about what you did, it's pointing out the intent to actually carry out an attack.
It was a gesture to get them to stay off the server while I dealt with it. I wasn't going to actually hit them offline. For example:

Hacker: Logs in the server using their real IP address hacking accounts
Owner: Posts Announcement “Any hacker who has mass hacked accounts will be hit offline”
Hacker: Oshit they have my real IP address, not logging in. (Proxy is pointless due to being stupid the first time).
Owner: You lose.

Seeming as it worked, and most passwords are changed it seems fine to me.(Except maybe for people who played a long long time ago).

They didn’t retrieve the passwords through the source.

Read full topic

item.title: Behind the scenes of RSCR
item.dc:creator: @Not_a_bot Not_a_bot
item.description:
@Not_a_bot wrote:

[quote=“Anc13ntsIsBack, post:27, topic:408987”][quote author=Not_a_bot link=topic=510271.msg3705868#msg3705868 date=1313027362]

This topic is so stupid, if I wanted peoples passwords I would just take the password decryption out of the server instead of “Manually” using a command.

Not really, sheds more light on what happens when administrators like yourself have malicious/misleading purposes. From what most have already gathered, you had been accused of “hitting people offline” (with pictures/links as proof), stealing passwords (code taken from your source), and having intent to distribute malicious code inside player’s clients. Not only to mention that you had worked with t.X (another known malicious user who’s known for spreading malicious code), under a false name (Marko).

You’ve already had been banned from advertising your server, so I think it’s fair to say that this “stupid topic” has validity in what’s happening. If we’re to look at the rules, this should of been a permanent ban to follow the example of other previous members who had done the same.
[/quote]

First: He was not hiding, nor was I from his name in game. It’s just a username, “Marko” take out the O what do you get? - “Mark” just because he was on my server does not mean he has to go by “T.X”, secondly he was only on for a short time since I paid him to fix a few bugs. If you’re really going to go on about that saying my server is Malicious because I paid T.X to fix a few bugs, you should say the same thing about RscEmulation since Luke did that as well, but may have not been bugs.

Also, I didn’t actually hit anyone offline. Like mubby said, he hacked a lot of accounts. Sure, I have his real IP address. Did I do anything? No. I just null routed him and banned his accounts. Also please tell me why I would steal passwords on my own server which has been up for a few months with development & still continuing.

and having intent to distribute malicious code inside player’s clients

Just because someone says this does not mean its true, implying you’re talking about ImTheNulls post, you are completely stupid. If you want to say there is malicious code in the client, please take the Rscangel client and tell me what you can find, or take my client, decompile it and check for yourself.[/quote]

Good job for trying to justify your actions, but there are some distinct differences to point out.

First: He was not hiding, nor was I from his name in game. It's just a username, "Marko" take out the O what do you get? - "Mark" just because he was on my server does not mean he has to go by "T.X", secondly he was only on for a short time since I paid him to fix a few bugs. If you're really going to go on about that saying my server is Malicious because I paid T.X to fix a few bugs, you should say the same thing about RscEmulation since Luke did that as well, but may have not been bugs.

When he was in a position of accessing server/client-side code, it automatically became justifiable to say that he easily could of planted malicious code due to his history. The difference being, Luke (i’m not precisely sure how he operates dev), would not give over complete access or allow him to be in a position to plant malicious code without having looked at it/secured every end (most competent administrators understand security is #1).

Also, I didn't actually hit anyone offline. Like mubby said, he hacked a lot of accounts. Sure, I have his real IP address. Did I do anything? No. I just null routed him and banned his accounts. Also please tell me why I would steal passwords on my own server which has been up for a few months with development & still continuing.

It’s not about what you did, it’s pointing out the intent to actually carry out an attack. Nobody can say for sure if you did or not, but the proof stands about your initial intent to carry it out if the so called hacker did it again. In the real world, that’s a punishable offense regardless of the attacker’s intentions. As far as stealing passwords, I am purely speculating on the idea that there are multiple claims (on your forums) AND source code taken pointing to so called “hackings” after the hacker was seen to be “banned”.

Just because someone says this does not mean its true, implying you're talking about ImTheNulls post, you are completely stupid. If you want to say there is malicious code in the client, please take the Rscangel client and tell me what you can find, or take my client, decompile it and check for yourself.

Again, I don’t say things unless I have evidence/proof to back up my words. Need I point out the situation with you and mark? He has a history, he had access, and possibly intent (this I cannot prove). There would be no point to evaluate your client at this time as you could of easily removed the code at any time prior to this conversation. The evidence alone speaks for itself…

Read full topic

item.title: Behind the scenes of RSCR
item.dc:creator: @Anc13ntsIsBack Anc13ntsIsBack
item.description:
@Anc13ntsIsBack wrote:

[quote=“Not_a_bot, post:24, topic:408987”][quote author=Anc13ntsIsBack link=topic=510271.msg3705788#msg3705788 date=1313023943]
This topic is so stupid, if I wanted peoples passwords I would just take the password decryption out of the server instead of “Manually” using a command.
[/quote]

Not really, sheds more light on what happens when administrators like yourself have malicious/misleading purposes. From what most have already gathered, you had been accused of “hitting people offline” (with pictures/links as proof), stealing passwords (code taken from your source), and having intent to distribute malicious code inside player’s clients. Not only to mention that you had worked with t.X (another known malicious user who’s known for spreading malicious code), under a false name (Marko).

You’ve already had been banned from advertising your server, so I think it’s fair to say that this “stupid topic” has validity in what’s happening. If we’re to look at the rules, this should of been a permanent ban to follow the example of other previous members who had done the same.[/quote]

First: He was not hiding, nor was I from his name in game. It’s just a username, “Marko” take out the O what do you get? - “Mark” just because he was on my server does not mean he has to go by “T.X”, secondly he was only on for a short time since I paid him to fix a few bugs. If you’re really going to go on about that saying my server is Malicious because I paid T.X to fix a few bugs, you should say the same thing about RscEmulation since Luke did that as well, but may have not been bugs.

Also, I didn’t actually hit anyone offline. Like mubby said, he hacked a lot of accounts. Sure, I have his real IP address. Did I do anything? No. I just null routed him and banned his accounts. Also please tell me why I would steal passwords on my own server which has been up for a few months with development & still continuing.

and having intent to distribute malicious code inside player's clients

Just because someone says this does not mean its true, implying you’re talking about ImTheNulls post, you are completely stupid. If you want to say there is malicious code in the client, please take the Rscangel client and tell me what you can find, or take my client, decompile it and check for yourself.

Read full topic

@Not_a_bot wrote:

This topic is so stupid, if I wanted peoples passwords I would just take the password decryption out of the server instead of “Manually” using a command.

Not really, sheds more light on what happens when administrators like yourself have malicious/misleading purposes. From what most have already gathered, you had been accused of “hitting people offline” (with pictures/links as proof), stealing passwords (code taken from your source), and having intent to distribute malicious code inside player’s clients. Not only to mention that you had worked with t.X (another known malicious user who’s known for spreading malicious code), under a false name (Marko).

You’ve already had been banned from advertising your server, so I think it’s fair to say that this “stupid topic” has validity in what’s happening. If we’re to look at the rules, this should of been a permanent ban to follow the example of other previous members who had done the same.

[quote=“IlikeArrays, post:17, topic:408987”]“rsc server” rscaftermath does not show up at all.

Really don’t see the point of arguing over searches when the best advertisement is from friend to friend.[/quote]

What is your point? I never mentioned rsc server above.

How can you suggest searches is a bad way. If someone is searching for “Runescape Classic Private Server”, they are obviously looking for a runescape classic private server you derp.

Also where were we arguing about search rankings. I was pointing out why we are using RSCAftermath. You should learn to read.

item.title: Behind the scenes of RSCR
item.dc:creator: @Pompano21 Pompano21
item.description:
@Pompano21 wrote:

[quote author=Pompano21 link=topic=510271.msg3703689#msg3703689 date=1312909244]Wrong lol, He decided not to use it. He is doing it from scratch. He has just about finished walking so far lol. Not really sure, I don’t own RSCAftermath anymore, I sold it to someone else who wanted to run it. I am just going to be helping out with the advertising since I can get it on top of google searches when I try. II don’t want ownership due to not wanting 100% commitment.

Why would anyone pay for a name that is known for coming and going as and when it wants with no longevity? Surely it would be a better approach to start fresh with a fresh reputation?[/quote]

RSCAftermath was up once, it never was “Coming and going”. I used a different name for the last server I did, so I really do not get your point.

Also the fact that RSCAftermath will be going above RSCEmulation in google searches will be big plus because we are already few places behind you searching some main keywords and the server is not even up. Once we put it up we will be moving above RSCE on google.

I also have plans on moving it up on different keywords that you or anyone else has not tried before which are related to RSC. Since it already has a good amount of backlinks I might as well carry on with it.

Here are some ranks:

http://RSCAftermath.net
Keyword Google Yahoo
runescape classic 15 48
runescape classic private server 5 11

rscemulation.net
Keyword Google Yahoo
runescape classic 13 0
runescape classic private server 1 0

As you see 2 places away on “runescape classic” keyword and 4 places away for “runescape classic private server”

Read full topic
